tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 七殿五舎（しちでんごしゃ）とは、平安京内裏の紫宸殿や仁寿殿の後方に位置し、主に天皇の后妃の住まう殿舎を指す。
sen.e: Shichidengosha refers to palace buildings located behind Shishinden (The Throne Hall) and Jijuden (literally, hall of benevolence and longevity) in the dairi (inner palace grounds) of the Heian Palace, which are mainly used as the residence of an empress, who is a wife of an emperor.

Shichidengosha refers to the palace buildings located behind Shishinden (The Throne Hall) and Jijuden (literally, hall of benevolence and longevity) in the dairi (inner palace grounds) of the Heian Palace, which were mainly used as the residence of the empresses of the emperors.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。are→were,an empress, who is a wife of an emperor.→the empresses of the emperors と修正しました。
sen.e: Shichidengosha refers to the palace buildings located behind Shishinden (The Throne Hall) and Jijuden (literally, hall of benevolence and longevity) in the dairi (inner palace grounds) of the Heian Palace, which were mainly used as the residence of the empresses of the emperors.

sen.j: これらは後宮と総称され、后妃以外にも東宮やその妃、また親王・内親王などもしばしば殿舎を賜った。
sen.e: These are collectively called kokyu, and the buildings were often granted to members other than the empress, including an togu (crown prince), his wife, imperial princes or imperial princesses.

These were collectively called kokyu, and the buildings were often granted to those members other than the empress, including the togu (crown prince), his wives, the imperial princes and the imperial princesses.
sen.cmt: those, the を補いました。are→were,an togu→togu,wife→wives,or→and と修正しました。
sen.e: These were collectively called kokyu, and the buildings were often granted to those members other than the empress, including the togu (crown prince), his wives, the imperial princes and the imperial princesses.

sen.cmt: 後列の「からなる。」が文章として独立していないため、こちらにコピーし、文章として造り変えています。
as follows を補いました。
後列の「からなる。」が文章として独立していないため、こちらにコピーし、文章として造り変えています。
as follows を補いました。

sen.j: 七殿は七間四面（母屋（もや）が東西七間・南北二間で四方に庇がある）、五舎は五間四面（身舎が東西五間・南北二間で四方に庇がある）で、このうち昭陽舎と淑景舎のみ、それぞれ五間二面の北舎が付属する。
sen.e: The Shichiden buildings had a shichiken shimen structure (the main building with the lengths of shichiken [approx. 12.73 m] in an east-west direction by niken [approx. 3.64 m] in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), and gosha buildings had a goken shimen structure (the main building of goken [approx. 9.09 m] in an east-west direction by niken in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), among which Shoyosha and Shigeisha are provided with a hokusha (north annex).

The Shichiden buildings had a shichiken shimen structure (the main building with the lengths of shichiken [approx. 12.73 m] in an east-west direction by niken [approx. 3.64 m] in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), and gosha buildings had a goken shimen structure (the main building of goken [approx. 9.09 m] in an east-west direction by niken in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), among which Shoyosha and Shigeisha are provided with a hokusha (north annex) of goken nimen structure.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。「五間二面」を補いました。
sen.e: The Shichiden buildings had a shichiken shimen structure (the main building with the lengths of shichiken [approx. 12.73 m] in an east-west direction by niken [approx. 3.64 m] in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), and gosha buildings had a goken shimen structure (the main building of goken [approx. 9.09 m] in an east-west direction by niken in a north-south direction, surrounded by eaves in all directions), among which Shoyosha and Shigeisha are provided with a hokusha (north annex) of goken nimen structure.

sen.j: 七殿は内裏創建時から存在し、五舎よりも格が上であるとされる。
sen.e: Shichiden buildings were built when the dairi was founded, and considered higher in rank than gosha.
Shichiden buildings have existed since the dairi was built, and considered higher in rank than gosha.
sen.cmt: were built→have existed since,found→built と修正しました。
sen.e: Shichiden buildings have existed since the dairi was built, and considered higher in rank than gosha.
